title: Beware the birds: Bird flu confirmed in Boston
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Bird flu confirmed in Boston's Emerald Necklace park system, affecting public health advisories.
Boston Public Health Commission says risk remains low but advises avoiding contact with wildlife.
CDC reports 71 human bird flu cases in US since 2024, with symptoms similar to seasonal flu.

title: Top NFL Draft prospect Fernando Mendoza enthralled by possibility of Tom Brady mentorship: ‘It would mean so much’
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Fernando Mendoza, top 2026 NFL Draft prospect, expressed excitement about potential mentorship from Tom Brady, co-owner of the Las Vegas Raiders.
Mendoza, 22, led Indiana Hoosiers to a national title and won the Heisman Trophy, throwing 41 touchdowns this past season.
Mendoza completed a pre-draft interview with the Raiders and spoke with Brady, hoping for future in-person meetings.

title: 5 must-watch movies & TV shows streaming right now
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: 'Kiss of the Spider Woman' starring Jennifer Lopez is streaming on Hulu.
'Paul McCartney: Man on the Run', a Beatles documentary, is available on Prime Video.
'Bridgerton' Season 4 Part 2 is now streaming on Netflix.

title: Red Sox’ Roman Anthony and Ceddanne Rafaela say they’re fine after outfield collision
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Red Sox outfielders Roman Anthony and Ceddanne Rafaela collided in a spring training game against the Atlanta Braves.
Both players were assessed by trainers and continued playing, each recording hits in the third inning.
The collision was attributed to miscommunication, with neither player sustaining serious injuries.

title: Alex Cora to donate $20K to Jimmy Fund when 2026 Red Sox hit this milestone
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Alex Cora pledges $20,000 to the Jimmy Fund if a Red Sox player hits 20 home runs in 2026.
Cora's donation would be his largest to the Jimmy Fund, supporting Dana-Farber Cancer Institute in Boston.
Cora previously donated based on Red Sox wins and runs, tying contributions to his jersey number, 13.

title: N.H. House advances bill targeting ‘indoctrination’ in public schools
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: The New Hampshire House advanced the CHARLIE Act, restricting public school instruction on race, American history, and LGBTQ+ issues.
The CHARLIE Act passed 184–164, preventing teachings that promote division; now advancing to the Senate for consideration.
Teachers violating this bill could face disciplinary actions, including credential revocation; individuals may sue for $10,000 per violation.

title: The story behind these colorful icicles in the Berkshires
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Colorful icicles on Route 2 in North Adams result from food coloring added to the ice.
This tradition of coloring icicles at the Hairpin Turn has been practiced for decades.
North Adams features attractions like The Golden Eagle Restaurant and MASS MoCA nearby the Hairpin Turn.

title: Mass. reports first two measles cases of 2026, including one in Greater Boston
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Massachusetts confirms two measles cases in 2026, one involving a child diagnosed out-of-state.
An adult with an uncertain vaccination history visited several Greater Boston locations while contagious.
U.S. faces large national measles outbreak with 1,136 cases in 2026, CDC reports.

title: Local obituary: Morgan Mallard-Vitiello, 33, lifelong South Boston resident and mother of 2
author: Boston.com Staff
bullets: Morgan Mallard-Vitiello, 33, lifelong South Boston resident, passed away on February 21, 2026, after a brief illness.
She was a mother of two, known for her work with Boston Inspectional Services and her neighborhood presence.
Funeral services will be held at St. Mary of the Assumption Church in Dedham on March 4, 2026.

title: She’s running Boston for The ALS Association in memory of her dad
author: Autumn Sloboda
bullets: Lauren Hamilton, 26, from Tampa, Florida, is running the 2026 Boston Marathon in memory of her late father.
Hamilton's father, who worked as a salesman in Boston, passed away from ALS when she was 25.
The runner is raising awareness and support for The ALS Association through her marathon participation.
